critique: This document delegates presidential authority regarding military justice to the Secretaries of the Army, Navy, Air Force, and Treasury (for the Coast Guard). It does not obviously lean left or right (Ideological Tilt). It does not concern immigration (Immigration Approach). It delegates some executive power, so it slightly restricts executive power (Executive Power). It shifts power to the secretaries of various departments, which could be seen as a slight shift away from federal control, but it's primarily an internal delegation within the executive branch (Federalism). It does not directly address national security vs. civil liberties (National Security vs. Civil Liberties). It does not directly regulate the economy (Economic Regulation). It does not address social inclusion (Social Inclusion).
